intro: Sarcopteryx reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined fern, is a tropical plant characterized by its intricate, lacy foliage. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to humid regions of Central and South America. The plant features fronds that are deeply divided, with a distinctive reticulate pattern on the underside. Its reproductive structures include sporangia clustered in strobili, typical of ferns. Sarcopteryx reticulata thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
